name: com.noesis.noesisgui
description: NoesisGUI is a multiplatform user interface middleware with support for true vectors. It is heavily optimized for video games and is deeply integrated in Unity. NoesisGUI has a rich ecosystem, with a first class UI editor and tools.

samples.description: A minimalist Hello World sample created with NoesisGUI.
A menu with buttons showcasing how to set Visual States to customize the appearance, and how to use command bindings to hook events using MVVM style.
An example of using OnRender and DrawingContext as a memory efficient way to render rectangles, lines, text, or any arbitrary geometric shapes.
A showcase of how to use a TextBox and a PasswordBox to implement a login panel. Information entered by the user is gathered using MVVM and commands.
A quest log which uses data binding to interact with data. The interface is populated by taking information from an ObservableCollection in a model class.
A localized menu using the Loc markup extension, rich text, and data binding. Displays in English, French, Japanese and Arabic.
An example of how to use DataTrigger and data binding to modify the appaerance of UI elements using model property values.
A solar system showcasing the power of Styles and Templates in NoesisGUI.
A typical inventory panel showcasing how to use Drag & Drop, and interactivity Behaviors, in games.
The classic paper-and-pencil game for two players, implemented in NoesisGUI.
Buttons with procedural pattern brushes driven by a pixel shader.
A demonstration of using MediaElement to play videos, in combination with custom effects and blending modes.
A showcase of using Rive vector graphics and animations in NoesisGUI, controlling them using bindings and interaction triggers.
Demonstrates how to use the BackgroundEffect behavior to create impressive dynamic background effects.
A first person scene showcasing the use of WorldSpace UI to create diegetic interfaces, with VR support.
